info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 2 at 3:14PM CDT until April 2 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell, Shannon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas and Ozark.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 314 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Lick Creek at County Road 528, Bennetts River at Highway 142, Bennetts Bayou at Highway 142, Eleven Point River at County Road 1550, Spring Creek at County Road 349, Possum Walk Creek at Highway T and Gill Branch at Highway Y. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Mountain View, Willow Springs, Gainesville, Bakersfield, Pomona, South Fork, Pontiac, Sundown, Pottersville, Siloam Springs, Caulfield, Dora, Moody, Sycamore, Tecumseh, Udall, Zanoni, White Church, Lanton, Hardenville, Peace Valley, Isabella, Norfork Lake, Bull Shoals Lake and Ozark National Scenic Riverways. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Douglas, MO; Howell, MO; Ozark, MO; Shannon, MO; Texas, MO
